id.description:
Unique identifier for the experiment. This is a duplicate of slug, but is a required field
for all Remote Settings records.

application.description: A specific product such as Firefox Desktop or Fenix that supports Nimbus experiments

userFacingName.description: Public name of the experiment displayed on "about:studies"

userFacingDescription.description: Short public description of the experiment displayed on on "about:studies"

isEnrollmentPaused.description: Should we enroll new users into the experiment?

randomizationUnit.description: A unique, stable identifier for the user used as an input to bucket hashing

namespace.description: Additional inputs to the hashing function

start.description: Index of start of the range of buckets

probeSets.description: A list of probe set slugs relevant to the experiment analysis

ratio.description:
Relative ratio of population for the branch (e.g. if branch A=1 and branch B=3,
branch A would get 25% of the population)

featureId.description: The identifier for the feature flag

enabled.description: This can be used to turn the whole feature on/off

value.description: Optional extra params for the feature (this should be validated against a schema)

targeting.description: JEXL expression used to filter experiments based on locale, geo, etc.

startDate.description:
Actual publish date of the experiment
Note that this value is expected to be null in Remote Settings.

endDate.description:
Actual end date of the experiment.
Note that this value is expected to be null in Remote Settings.

proposedDuration.description:
Duration of the experiment from the start date in days.
Note that this value is expected to be null in Remote Settings.
in Remote Settings.

proposedEnrollment.description: Duration of enrollment from the start date in days

referenceBranch.description: The slug of the reference branch

filter_expression.description:
This is NOT used by Nimbus, but has special functionality in Remote Settings.
See https://remote-settings.readthedocs.io/en/latest/target-filters.html#how

NimbusExperiment.description:
The experiment definition accessible to:
1. The Nimbus SDK via Remote Settings
2. Jetstream via the Experimenter API
